name: Steve Blank
background: Steve Blank is an American entrepreneur, educator, and author best known for developing the Customer Development methodology, which laid the foundation for the Lean Startup movement. A serial entrepreneur who founded or worked at eight startups, Blank transitioned to academia where he taught at UC Berkeley, Stanford, and Columbia. He created the Lean LaunchPad class and NSF I-Corps program, training thousands of scientists to commercialize innovations. His key books include 'The Four Steps to the Epiphany' and co-authored 'The Startup Owner's Manual'. Blank extended his methods to national security via Hacking for Defense and founded Stanford's Gordian Knot Center.

principles.name: Customer Development
principles.description: Iterative process of getting out of the building to test hypotheses about customers/problems via interviews, parallel to product development.
principles.falsification: When customer development leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Fail Fast, Pivot
principles.description: No business plan survives customers; use evidence to pivot or persevere.
principles.falsification: When fail fast, pivot leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Four Steps
principles.description: (1) Discovery (problems), (2) Validation (product-market fit), (3) Customer Creation (demand), (4) Company Building (organization).
principles.falsification: When four steps leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Lean LaunchPad
principles.description: Combines Customer Development, Business Model Canvas, and Agile for rapid hypothesis testing.
principles.falsification: When lean launchpad leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
